intro: Bupleurum rollii, commonly known as the Kashmir bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Bupleurum rollii is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats at high elevations.
